tweet:
Yesterday the Committee discussed how the #GOPTaxScam showers benefits on the wealthy and big corporations while leaving working families behind.

More from @CenterOnBudget: https://www.cbpp.org/blog/6-ways-the-2017-tax-law-hurts-low-and-moderate-income-households …
Rep @Ilhan Omar: The #GOPTaxScam hasn't improved the lives of working Americans who are struggling with rising costs of living. pic.twitter.com/XSwx3yy7wT
Rep. @JanSchakowsky: We've seen corporations spend record-breaking sums on stock buybacks since passage of the #GOPTaxScam. pic.twitter.com/SpkNh1hvAY
.@RepScottPeters: The nonpartisan CBO shows that the #GOPTaxScam will add $1.9T to the debt in the next decade. pic.twitter.com/2eAZjt3HRW

In today's hearing, Republicans are continuing to repeat their 3-step scam:
 
1. Provide deficit-financed tax cuts to the wealthy
2. Suddenly rediscover their fear of debt
3. Target Social Security, Medicare, and other crucial programs for cuts
Chairman @RepJohnYarmuth: For American families, the #GOPTaxScam is a huge and predictable failure. For the federal budget, it’s a huge and predictable drain.
Chairman @RepJohnYarmuth: Under the #GOPTaxScam, nearly all the cuts are going to the top one percent and corporations. Meanwhile, hardworking American families are left to pay the price.

Chairman @RepJohnYarmuth: Instead of collaboration on bipartisan tax reform that lifts up the middle class, and instead of heeding the warnings of economists and the nonpartisan CBO, Congressional Republicans chose to enact massive tax cuts for the wealthy and large corporations.

At 10:00 AM ET, the Committee will discuss the failures of the GOP Tax Scam at our hearing, "The 2017 Tax Law: Impact on the Budget and American Families."

Watch live below, and learn more here:  https://budget.house.gov/publications/publication/gop-tax-law-showers-benefits-wealthy-and-large-corporations-while … https://twitter.com/i/broadcasts/1djGXOQyjEyKZ …
Congratulations Rep. @SethMoulton, the new Vice Chairman of the Committee. pic.twitter.com/x6dpSKLyN6

The Trump Admin is so out of touch, it thinks national & economic security investments are “irresponsible.” Here’s what the last budget deal let us fund:
•Food Safety Inspection
•Child Care Development Grants
•CDC
•EPA
•Countering Russia Influence Fund

#RaiseTheCaps https://twitter.com/RussVought45/status/1100180018901209088 …

By charging the #GOPTaxScam to our nation's credit card, Republicans enacted their scam to benefit the rich and make you pay for it:

Step 1: Cut taxes for wealthy & corporations
Step 2: Explode deficit
Step 3: Demand cuts to Medicare, Medicaid, & more https://www.nytimes.com/2018/07/25/business/trump-corporate-tax-cut-deficit.html …
After raking in billions in tax cuts, big pharmaceutical companies have actually RAISED the prices of some drugs. #GOPTaxScam https://twitter.com/CAPAction/status/1100449160195657729 …

While real wage growth for working families has been disappointing, big banks have raked in billions in additional profits profits thanks to the #GOPTaxScam. https://thehill.com/policy/finance/431033-us-banks-made-28-billion-in-extra-profits-thanks-to-gop-tax-bill …

Republicans promised their #GOPTaxScam would make filing season easier for all Americans. Now working families are discovering that they aren’t getting the refunds they expected. https://www.latimes.com/business/la-fi-tax-refunds-decline-trump-irs-20190223-story.html …

Instead of raising employees’ wages or benefits, corporations have spent their #GOPTaxScam windfalls rewarding their CEOs and wealthy investors. https://www.cnn.com/2018/12/17/investing/stock-buybacks-trillion-dollars/index.html …
In advance of our hearing tomorrow on the #GOPTaxScam, and a year into its enactment, let’s do a reality check on the claims made by the Trump Administration and Congressional Republicans. Thread:

Tomorrow the Committee will discuss the failures of the #GOPTaxScam at our hearing. Tune in at 10:00 AM ET

 https://budget.house.gov/legislation/hearings/2017-tax-law-impact-budget-and-american-families … pic.twitter.com/DFEQeiov9c

The Trump Admin didn’t care about deficits when jamming through the #GOPTaxScam to give millionaires tax cuts. But now they want to undercut critical investments in our families in the name of fiscal responsibility. The American people won’t be fooled.
    https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/2019/02/25/trumps-budget-chief-just-wrote-stunningly-disingenuous-call-congress-cut-spending/?utm_term=.09a7eb11f3ce …

Democrats are standing up to the Trump Administration's dishonest budgeting schemes. Statement from Chairman @RepJohnYarmuth and @HASCDemocrats Chairman @RepAdamSmith:  https://budget.house.gov/news/press-releases/chairman-yarmuth-and-chairman-smith-denounce-trump-budget-s-planned-use-defense … pic.twitter.com/1AeGcLlV5v

We’ll talk more about the failures of the tax law at our full committee hearing on Wednesday at 10am ET. https://budget.house.gov/legislation/hearings/2017-tax-law-impact-budget-and-american-families …
The clear winner from the #GOPTaxScam isn’t families or workers. It’s the big banks. https://www.cbsnews.com/news/new-tax-law-changes-produce-a-clear-winner-2019-americas-very-profitable-banks/ …

Instead of prioritizing wealthy investors and CEOs while adding $1.9 trillion to the national debt, we need to make smart investments that support hardworking Americans.

Next week, we will hold a hearing on the real-world implications of the #GOPTaxScam: https://budget.house.gov/publications/publication/gop-tax-law-showers-benefits-wealthy-and-large-corporations-while …

Despite the Trump Administration's claims, the #GOPTaxScam hasn't:
✖Boosted worker wages
✖Brought back jobs from overseas
✖Paid for itself

In fact, workers and small business have seen few benefits in the year since enactment.

Earlier this month, we held a hearing at which experts testified on the broad array of vital programs that are at risk of budget cuts if Congress does not act now to #RaiseTheCaps.

Learn more: https://budget.house.gov/publications/report/congress-must-act-now-raise-caps …

Non-defense discretionary spending unleashes opportunities for working families and the middle class. 

Congress recognized the need for more investments with the Bipartisan Budget Act of 2018, but now cuts are again on the horizon unless Congress takes action.

Earlier this month, we held a hearing at which experts testified on the broad array of vital programs that are at risk of budget cuts if Congress does not act now to #RaiseTheCaps.

More in our latest report:  https://budget.house.gov/publications/report/congress-must-act-now-raise-caps …

Non-defense discretionary spending unleashes opportunities for working families and the middle class. 

Congress recognized the need for more investments with the Bipartisan Budget Act of 2018, but now cuts are on the horizon again unless Congress takes action.

The Trump Administration claimed the #GOPTaxScam would raise wages for workers.

Instead, data continues to show how big corporations have used their tax windfalls to further enrich wealthy investors and CEOs. https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/congress/big-businesses-promised-wage-hikes-trump-s-tax-cuts-what-n970081?fbclid=IwAR1T3qngaDhEJBGU6OBu1Vc7uJG6GUZSYV7jBkB9Y1R2z79MfTCkUasR7s0 …
Soon: Tune in to @MSNBC to watch Chairman @RepJohnYarmuth live on @Morning_Joe.
Chairman @RepJohnYarmuth: "The House has not ceded, and we will not cede, our Constitutional power of the purse. We will act to protect it.”  https://bit.ly/2TQLw6h  pic.twitter.com/gusYh2dO6c

Returning the country to a sustainable fiscal path can only begin with an honest assessment of the #GOPTaxScam's impact on our nation’s long-term economic and budgetary health.

More in our report: https://budget.house.gov/publications/report/cbo-confirms-gop-tax-law-contributes-darkening-fiscal-future …

At our first hearing this year, CBO Director Keith Hall unambiguously refuted Trump Administration officials' claims that the #GOPTaxScam will pay for itself.

In fact, it will add nearly $2 trillion to our nation's deficit over the next decade. https://www.npr.org/2019/02/13/694199256/u-s-national-debt-hits-22-trillion-a-new-record-thats-predicted-to-fall …

Trump is seriously mistaken if he thinks Dem support for the spending deal gives him a green light to take $ from other programs for his ineffective wall. We will use every means possible to stop POTUS from ignoring Congressional intent and circumventing our power of the purse.
Welcome to the House Budget Committee, @RepSires. pic.twitter.com/WBxpEYLKOV
Welcome to the House Budget Committee, @RepScottPeters. pic.twitter.com/UDBZsRAiGr
Welcome back to the House Budget Committee, @RepJimCooper. pic.twitter.com/snHSgM3t5J

While wealthy CEOs and investors received huge tax windfalls, working families may be in for an unpleasant surprise with their first tax filing under the #GOPTaxScam. https://www.cnbc.com/2019/02/11/average-tax-refunds-are-down-8point4percent-in-wake-of-trump-tax-cuts.html …
Thank you to today's witnesses for testifying at our hearing on Investing in America’s Economic and National Security. pic.twitter.com/ehScfeyyAD

Chairman @RepJohnYarmuth: Congress must #RaiseTheCaps for both defense and non-defense spending. We have done so in a bipartisan manner in the past, and we must do so again now.

Chairman @RepJohnYarmuth: The unprecedented 5-week #TrumpShutdown, which resulted in a permanent loss of $3B to our economy, reminded all of us that non-discretionary investments are security investments.

Chairman @RepJohnYarmuth: If Congress does not take action, federal programs that support homeland security, disaster preparedness, and Pell grants - programs that are vital to our economic and national security - will face devastating cuts. pic.twitter.com/yubQlKH3JV

At 10:00 AM ET, the committee will hold a hearing titled "Investing in America's Economic and National Security." Tune in!

 https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lRapX2GxwSk …

Congress has adjusted the caps in prior fiscal years to avoid severely underfunding discretionary programs, but unless Congress acts, these drastic cuts again threaten our national and economic security. #RaiseTheCaps pic.twitter.com/8Qi5ix3y9q

Tomorrow the committee will hold a hearing titled "Investing in America’s Economic and National Security" on the imperative need to raise discretionary spending caps.  https://budget.house.gov/legislation/hearings/investing-america-s-economic-and-national-security … pic.twitter.com/KZcndMhWQb
Democrats want to invest in America’s middle class by stabilizing our fiscal outlook and providing vital investments in our economy and communities. pic.twitter.com/dNAwLkpwkV

At our hearing last week, CBO Dir. Hall presented the agency’s latest Budget & Economic Outlook. The report shows a darkening fiscal future, with trillion-dollar deficits and record debt levels expected within a decade.
